error.signature: error: sparse-checkout is not enabled. Use 'git sparse-checkout init' to enable it.

verdict.summary: Git sparse-checkout commands fail because sparse-checkout is not initialized, or cone mode patterns are incorrectly specified. Often seen when migrating from non-cone sparse-checkout to cone mode or in CI environments.

dead_ends.action: Editing .git/info/sparse-checkout manually with non-cone patterns while cone mode is enabled
dead_ends.why_fails: Cone mode expects directory-based patterns; arbitrary gitignore-style patterns are silently ignored or cause errors

dead_ends.action: Running git read-tree -mu HEAD to force update the working tree
dead_ends.why_fails: This is the old sparse-checkout mechanism and conflicts with the new sparse-checkout command; it can leave the working tree in an inconsistent state

workarounds.action: Initialize sparse-checkout properly with cone mode
workarounds.how: Run git sparse-checkout init --cone, then git sparse-checkout set <directory1> <directory2> to specify which directories to include.

workarounds.action: Disable cone mode for complex patterns
workarounds.how: Run git sparse-checkout init --no-cone if you need gitignore-style patterns. Then use git sparse-checkout set with pattern syntax.

leads_to.condition: when sparse-checkout set unexpectedly removes files that have local modifications

preceded_by.condition: when sparse-checkout commands are run outside a git repository

frequently_confused_with.distinction: sparse-checkout-error is about the sparse-checkout configuration itself; pathspec-no-match is about git commands referencing files not present in the index or working tree
